Comments_List: Learnt a lot about models for describing metals and insulators, and the operation of semiconductors

Reciprocal lattice is a subject I've never encountered before. I've taken several courses in materials science, but reciprocal lattice was a topic which was avoided somehow, until I took this course. This course also paid a lot of attention of electronic and phononic dispersion curves, energy bands, etc. Looking at both types of excitations side-by-side in so much detail was very useful. It is good to be more familiar with their relative scales and the consequences of their different energy scales.
deeper insight into solid state physics and related phenomenon.

the difference between form factor and structure factor
the difference between the different brillouin zone schemes
